name: Concrete Driveways
title: Concrete Driveway Installation Columbus OH | Expert Contractors
description: Professional concrete driveway installation and replacement in Columbus, OH. Durable, long-lasting driveways that enhance your home's curb appeal. Free estimates, quality guaranteed.
heroText: Transform Your Home's Entrance with a Beautiful Concrete Driveway
benefits: Increases property value by up to 10%

faqs.question: How much does a concrete driveway cost in Columbus?
faqs.answer: Concrete driveway costs in Columbus range from $8-15 per square foot. A typical 600 sq ft driveway costs $4,800-$9,000. Stamped or decorative finishes add $2-5 per sq ft. We provide free detailed estimates for your specific project.

faqs.question: How long does a concrete driveway last?
faqs.answer: A properly installed concrete driveway lasts 25-30 years in the Columbus area. With regular sealing every 2-3 years, some driveways last 40+ years. Our quality installation and Ohio-rated concrete mixes ensure maximum longevity.

faqs.question: Can you pour concrete in Ohio winter?
faqs.answer: We can pour concrete when temperatures are consistently above 40¬∞F. For cold-weather pours, we use heated water, insulated blankets, and accelerating admixtures. We typically schedule November-March work for mild weather windows.

name: Concrete Patios
title: Concrete Patio Contractors Columbus OH | Custom Designs
description: Custom concrete patio design and installation in Columbus, OH. Create the perfect outdoor living space for entertaining and relaxation. Stamped, colored, and decorative options available.
heroText: Create Your Perfect Outdoor Living Space

faqs.question: What size patio should I build?
faqs.answer: For dining, plan 25 sq ft per person plus furniture space. A 12x12 (144 sq ft) patio seats 4-6 comfortably. For entertaining, 300-400 sq ft works well. We help design the perfect size for your needs and budget.

faqs.question: Is stamped concrete good for patios?
faqs.answer: Stamped concrete is excellent for patios - it offers the look of stone, brick, or tile at 30-50% less cost. It's durable, customizable, and easier to maintain than individual pavers. We offer dozens of patterns and colors.

faqs.question: Do concrete patios crack in Ohio weather?
faqs.answer: All concrete can develop minor cracks, but proper installation minimizes this. We use control joints, proper reinforcement, and Ohio-rated concrete mixes designed for freeze-thaw cycles. Small hairline cracks are normal and don't affect structural integrity.

name: Concrete Slabs
title: Concrete Slab Installation Columbus OH | Garages, Sheds, More
description: Commercial and residential concrete slab installation in Columbus. Garages, sheds, workshops, pole barns, and more. Engineered for proper load bearing and drainage.

faqs.question: How thick should a concrete slab be?
faqs.answer: Thickness depends on use: 4 inches for sheds and light storage, 5-6 inches for garages and workshops, 6-8 inches for heavy equipment. We engineer each slab for its intended load and use.

faqs.question: Do I need a permit for a concrete slab?
faqs.answer: In Franklin County, slabs for detached structures over 200 sq ft typically need permits. Slabs for garages always need permits. We handle permit paperwork and inspections as part of our service.

faqs.question: How long until I can use my new slab?
faqs.answer: Light foot traffic after 24-48 hours, vehicles after 7 days, heavy equipment after 28 days when full strength is reached. We provide specific guidance based on your project.

name: Stamped Concrete
title: Stamped Concrete Columbus OH | Decorative Patterns & Colors
description: Beautiful stamped concrete patterns that mimic natural stone, brick, and tile at a fraction of the cost. Expert installation in Columbus and Franklin County.
heroText: The Beauty of Natural Stone at Concrete Prices
benefits: Looks like natural stone or brick

faqs.question: How long does stamped concrete last?
faqs.answer: Stamped concrete lasts 25-30+ years with proper care. Resealing every 2-3 years maintains the color and protects the surface. It outlasts most pavers and requires less maintenance.

faqs.question: Is stamped concrete slippery when wet?
faqs.answer: Standard stamped concrete can be slippery. We offer non-slip additives and textured patterns for pool decks and high-traffic areas. We always recommend slip-resistant finishes for exterior applications.

faqs.question: Can stamped concrete be repaired?
faqs.answer: Yes, damaged sections can be repaired, though color matching can be challenging. Proper installation and maintenance prevent most damage. We warranty our stamped concrete work against installation defects.

name: Concrete Foundations
title: Concrete Foundation Contractors Columbus OH | New & Repair
description: Residential and commercial foundation services in Columbus. New construction, repairs, basement waterproofing, and structural reinforcement. Licensed and insured.
heroText: Building Strong Foundations for Columbus Homes

faqs.question: What type of foundation is best for Ohio?
faqs.answer: Most Columbus homes use poured concrete foundations with footings below the 32-inch frost line. Crawl space or full basement depends on lot conditions and preferences. We evaluate each site individually.

faqs.question: How do I know if my foundation needs repair?
faqs.answer: Warning signs include cracks wider than 1/4 inch, doors/windows sticking, uneven floors, water seepage, and visible bowing. We offer free foundation inspections and honest assessments.

faqs.question: Do you offer foundation waterproofing?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide interior and exterior waterproofing, drain tile systems, sump pump installation, and crack injection repairs. Waterproofing protects your investment and prevents moisture problems.

name: Concrete Walkways
title: Concrete Walkway Installation Columbus OH | Sidewalks & Paths
description: Professional sidewalk and walkway installation in Columbus. Safe, attractive paths for homes and businesses. ADA compliant options available.
heroText: Safe and Beautiful Walkways for Your Property

faqs.question: How wide should a walkway be?
faqs.answer: Front entry walks should be 4-5 feet wide for two people side-by-side. Garden paths can be 2-3 feet. Commercial walks need 5+ feet for ADA compliance. We help determine the right width for your needs.

faqs.question: Can walkways be heated?
faqs.answer: Yes, we install heated walkways using electric cables or hydronic tubing. Heated walks melt snow automatically - great for Columbus winters. Cost is higher but eliminates shoveling.

faqs.question: Do you repair existing sidewalks?
faqs.answer: Yes, we repair cracks, raise sunken sections (mudjacking), and replace damaged portions. Sometimes repair is more cost-effective than replacement - we provide honest recommendations.

name: Concrete Repair
title: Concrete Repair Services Columbus OH | Cracks, Leveling, More
description: Expert concrete repair services in Columbus. Crack repair, leveling, resurfacing, and restoration for driveways, patios, sidewalks, and more.
heroText: Restore Your Concrete to Like-New Condition

faqs.question: When should I repair vs replace concrete?
faqs.answer: Repair when damage is limited to surface issues, small cracks, or isolated areas. Replace when concrete is extensively cracked, heaving, or settling significantly. We provide honest assessments.

faqs.question: What causes concrete to crack?
faqs.answer: Common causes include ground movement, freeze-thaw cycles, tree roots, improper installation, and heavy loads. Ohio's clay soils and weather make proper installation crucial.

faqs.question: Can you fix uneven concrete?
faqs.answer: Yes, mudjacking or foam lifting can raise sunken concrete back to level. This costs 50-75% less than replacement and takes just hours. Not all slabs are candidates - we evaluate each situation.

name: Decorative Concrete
title: Decorative Concrete Columbus OH | Colors, Textures, Finishes
description: Transform ordinary concrete into extraordinary surfaces. Stained, colored, exposed aggregate, and specialty finishes for Columbus homes and businesses.
heroText: Artistry Meets Durability in Decorative Concrete
benefits: Works on new or existing concrete

faqs.question: What decorative options are available?
faqs.answer: Options include integral coloring, staining (acid or water-based), stamped patterns, exposed aggregate, polished concrete, and epoxy coatings. We can combine techniques for unique looks.

faqs.question: Can existing concrete be stained?
faqs.answer: Yes, most concrete can be stained to add color and character. The concrete must be clean and free of sealers. Acid stains create variegated, natural looks while water-based stains offer more consistent color.

faqs.question: How do you maintain decorative concrete?
faqs.answer: Regular cleaning with mild soap and resealing every 2-3 years keeps decorative concrete looking great. Avoid harsh chemicals and deicing salts. We provide specific care instructions for your finish.
